availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Principal office located at Lexington, Kentucky. Established by the Commonwealth of Kentucky on February 20, 1835. President(s): Madison C. Johnson. Cashier(s): Augustus F. Hawkins.
Branch office located at Barbourville, Kentucky. Dissolved by 1863. President(s): George M. Adams. Cashier(s): William McClanahan.
Branch office located at Covington, Kentucky. President(s): James M. Preston and James Taylor. Cashier(s): William Ernst.
Branch office located at Glasgow, Kentucky. President(s): George W. Trabue. Cashier(s): Thomas J. Gorin.

Branch office located at Louisville, Kentucky. President(s): William Richardson and L. L. Warren. Cashier(s): John Milton and Henry C. Pindell. Director(s): 1861—W. Mitchell, Sandford Duncan, E. A. Gardner, William E. Glover, W. F. Bullock, and L. L. Warren. 1864—William E. Glover, E. A. Gardner, William Hughes, D. B. Light, Robert Murrell, and R. A. Robinson.
Branch office located at Paris, Kentucky. President(s): Charlton Alexander and Robert T. Davis. Cashier(s): Thomas Kelly and Charlton Alexander.
Branch office located at Richmond, Kentucky. President(s): Daniel Breck. Cashier(s): E. L. Shackleford.

ab.bibl:
J. Smith Homans, ed., The Bankers' Magazine, and Statistical Register, vol. XII (June 1860): 995.
The Merchants' Bankers' Almanac for 1861 (New York: J. Smith Homans, Jr., Office of the Bankers' Magazine, 1861), 38.
The Merchants' Bankers' Almanac for 1863 (New York: J. Smith Homans, Jr., Office of the Bankers' Magazine, 1863), 20.
The Merchants' Bankers' Almanac for 1864 (New York: J. Smith Homans, Jr., Office of the Bankers' Magazine, 1864), 19. "An Act to establish the Northern Bank of Kentucky," Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, vol. 2 (Frankfort, Ky.: Albert G. Hodges, State Printer, 1834), 166-181.
Tanner's Louisville Directory, and Business Advertiser for 1861, Henry Tanner, comp. (Louisville: Henry Tanner, 1861), 324-325.
J. D. Campbell's Louisville Business Directory, for 1864 (Louisville: L. A. Civill, 1864), 89-91.
